mesh4d.obj3d.Obj3d_Deform#

class mesh4d.obj3d.Obj3d_Deform(**kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Obj3d_Kps

The dynamic/deformable 3D object with key points and transformations attached to it. Derived from Obj3d_Kps and attach the rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Rigid) and non-rigid deformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Nonrigid) to it.

Parameters:

**kwargs – parameters can be passed in via keywords arguments. Please refer to Obj3d and Obj3d_Kps for accepted parameters.

Note

Class Attributes

self.trans_rigid

the rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Rigid) of the 3D object.

self.trans_nonrigid

the non-rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Nonrigid) of the 3D object.

__init__(**kwargs)[source]#

set_trans_rigid(trans_rigid: Trans_Rigid)[source]#

Set rigid transformation.

Parameters:

trans_rigid – the rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Rigid).

set_trans_nonrigid(trans_nonrigid: Trans_Nonrigid)[source]#

Set non-rigid transformation.

Parameters:

trans_nonrigid – the non-rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Nonrigid).

get_deform_obj3d(mode: str = 'nonrigid')[source]#

Get the deformed 3D object.

Parameters:

mode –

  • nonrigid: the non-rigid transformation will be used to deform the object.

  • rigid: the rigid transformation will be used to deform the object.

Warning

Before calling this method, please make sure that the transformation has been estimated.

show_deform(kps_names: None | tuple | list = None, mode: str = 'nonrigid', cmap: str = 'cool')[source]#

Illustrate the mesh, the sampled point cloud, and the key points after the estimated deformation.

  • The mesh will be coloured with the distance of deformation. The mapping between distance and color is controlled by cmap argument. Noted that in default setting, light bule indicates small deformation and purple indicates large deformation.

  • The sampled points will be attached with displacement vectors to illustrate the displacement field.

  • The deformed key points will be shown attached to the mesh and point cloud.

Parameters:

  • scene – pyvista.Plotter scene to add the visualisation.

  • kps_names – a list of names of the Kps objects to be shown. Noted that a Kps object’s name is its keyword in self.kps_group.

  • mode –

    • nonrigid: the non-rigid transformation will be used to deform the object.

    • rigid: the rigid transformation will be used to deform the object.

  • cmap –

    the color map name.

    See also

    For full list of supported color map, please refer to Choosing Colormaps in Matplotlib.

Attention

Before calling this method in Jupyter Notebook environment, the static is needed to be selected:

import pyvista as pv
pv.set_jupyter_backend('static')
offset_rotate()[source]#

Offset the rotation according to the estimated rigid transformation.

Tip

This method usually serves for reorientate all 3D objects to a referencing direction, since that the rigid transformation (mesh4d.field.Trans_Rigid) is usually estimated according to the difference of two different 3D object.
